Name: SharepointFarm
Description: Creates a highly available SharePoint 2013 farm deployment.

Parameters.Name: Region
Parameters.Description: Azure region to which the infrastructure will be deployed.

Parameters.Name: AffinityGroup
Parameters.Description: Azure affinity group to which the infrastructure will be deployed.

Parameters.Name: VnetName
Parameters.Description: Azure Virtual Network for setting up Active Directory and Windows Failover Cluster.

Parameters.Name: DiskStore
Parameters.Description: Name of Azure storage account for creating VM disks.

Parameters.Name: ADCloudService
Parameters.Description: Name of the Azure Cloud Service to which Active Directory VMs are to be deployed.

Parameters.Name: FQDN
Parameters.Description: Fully qualified domain name for setting up active directory in the specified Azure Virtual Network.

Parameters.Name: Domain
Parameters.Description: NetBios domain name for setting up active directory in the specified Azure Virtual Network.

Parameters.Name: ADVMSize
Parameters.Description: Size of the Active Directory VMs.

Parameters.Name: SSAOCloudService
Parameters.Description: Name of the Azure Cloud Service.

Parameters.Name: ClusterName
Parameters.Description: Name of Windows Failover Cluster (on top of which SQL Availability group will be created). This has to be unique in the domain(setup within the virtual network).

Parameters.Name: AvailabilityGroupName
Parameters.Description: Name of SQL Server Availability Group. This has to be unique in the domain(setup within the virtual network).

Parameters.Name: NumberOfSQLNodes
Parameters.Description: No of SQL nodes. A minimum of two are required to create SQL Server Availability Group.

Parameters.Name: SQLVMSize
Parameters.Description: Size of the SQL VMs.

Parameters.Name: QuorumVMSize
Parameters.Description: Size of the Quorum VM.

Parameters.Name: SharepointCloudService
Parameters.Description: Name of the Azure Cloud Service.

Parameters.Name: AppServerCount
Parameters.Description: No of SharePoint App servers to be deployed.

Parameters.Name: WebServerCount
Parameters.Description: No of SharePoint web servers to be deployed.

Parameters.Name: SharepointVMSize
Parameters.Description: Size of the SharePoint VMs.

Parameters.Name: AdminName
Parameters.Description: Name of local administrator account.

Parameters.Name: AdminPassword
Parameters.Description: Password of local administrator account.

Parameters.Name: DSRMPassPhrase
Parameters.Description: Safemode Password for domain

Parameters.Name: SqlSvcAccountName

Parameters.Description: Password of SQL service account.

Parameters.Name: FarmAdminName

Resources.SetScript:
Function Format-RawDisks
{
    [cmdletbinding()]
    param([char]$nextDriveLetter)

	foreach ($disk in Get-Disk | Where PartitionStyle -eq 'RAW')
	{
		Write-Verbose "Formatting disk [$nextDriveLetter]"
		$disk | Initialize-Disk -PartitionStyle MBR -PassThru |
				New-Partition -DriveLetter $nextDriveLetter -UseMaximumSize |
				Format-Volume -FileSystem NTFS -Confirm:$false

		$nextDriveLetter = [char]([int]$nextDriveLetter + 1)
	}
}
Format-RawDisks $FirstDriveLetter[0] -ErrorAction Stop
Resources.Name: FormatRawDisks

Configurations.Name: SetupADForest
Configurations.Description: Configure this server as the first Active Directory domain controller in a new forest. See http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj574166.aspx

Resources.SetScript:
Write-Verbose "Creating forest [$DomainNetbiosName ($DomainName)]"
Import-Module ADDSDeployment -Verbose:$false
Install-ADDSForest -DomainName $DomainName `
                   -DomainNetbiosName $DomainNetbiosName `
                   -ForestMode 'Win2012' `
                   -DomainMode 'Win2012' `
                   -SafeModeAdministratorPassword (ConvertTo-SecureString $DSRMPassPhrase -AsPlainText -Force) `
                   -InstallDns `
                   -DatabasePath $DatabasePath `
                   -LogPath $LogPath `
                   -SysvolPath $SysvolPath `
                   -Force `
                   -NoRebootOnCompletion `
                   -ErrorAction Stop `
                   -WarningAction SilentlyContinue
Write-Verbose 'Rebooting'
$global:DSCMachineStatus = 1
Resources.TestScript:
$d = Get-WmiObject Win32_NTDomain
if ($d.Status -eq 'OK' -AND 
    $d.DnsForestName -eq $DomainName -AND 
    $d.DomainName -eq $DomainNetbiosName -AND 
    $d.DomainControllerName -eq "\\$env:COMPUTERNAME")
{
	Write-Verbose "Domain [$DomainNetbiosName ($DomainName)] already configured."
	return $true
}
return $false
Resources.Name: SetupForest

Configurations.Name: SetupADDomainController
Configurations.Description: Configure this server as an additional Active Directory domain controller. See http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj574134.aspx.

Resources.SetScript:
Write-Verbose "Creating domain [$DomainNetbiosName ($DomainName)]"
Import-Module ADDSDeployment -Verbose:$false

# Temporarily make the RootDC our DNS Server...
Set-DnsClientServerAddress -InterfaceAlias 'Ethernet*' -ServerAddresses $DCRootIPAddress -Validate -ErrorAction Stop

Install-ADDSDomainController -DomainName $DomainName `
                             -Credential (New-Object PsCredential($AdminUser, (ConvertTo-SecureString $AdminPass -AsPlainText -Force))) `
                             -SafeModeAdministratorPassword (ConvertTo-SecureString $DSRMPassPhrase -AsPlainText -Force) `
                             -InstallDns `
                             -NoGlobalCatalog `
                             -DatabasePath $DatabasePath `
                             -LogPath $LogPath `
                             -SysvolPath $SysvolPath `
                             -Force `
                             -NoRebootOnCompletion `
                             -ErrorAction Stop `
                             -WarningAction SilentlyContinue

# Point the DNS server at this server...
Set-DnsClientServerAddress -InterfaceAlias 'Ethernet*' -ServerAddresses '127.0.0.1' -Validate:$false

Write-Verbose 'Rebooting'
$global:DSCMachineStatus = 1
Resources.TestScript:
$d = Get-WmiObject Win32_NTDomain
if ($d.Status -eq 'OK' -AND 
    $d.DnsForestName -eq $DomainName -AND 
    $d.DomainName -eq $DomainNetbiosName -AND 
    $d.DomainControllerName -eq "\\$env:COMPUTERNAME")
{
	Write-Verbose "Domain [$DomainNetbiosName ($DomainName)] already configured."
	return $true
}
return $false

Resources.Name: CreateSqlAlwaysOnEndpoint
Resources.GetScript: @{ ServerInstance = $env:COMPUTERNAME; AllowedUser = $ServiceAccount; EndPointName = MyMirroringEndpoint; PortNumber = 5022; Configured = [bool] [int](OSQL -S $InstanceName -E -Q "select count(*) from master.sys.endpoints where name = '$Name'" -h-1)[0] }
Resources.SetScript:
$server = $env:COMPUTERNAME
$serverPath   = "SQLSERVER:\SQL\$server\Default"
$endpointName = "MyMirroringEndpoint"
$endpointPort = 5022
$endpointPath = "$serverPath\Endpoints\$endpointName"
New-SqlHadrEndpoint -Path $serverPath -Name $endpointName -Port $endpointPort -EA Stop | Out-Null
Write-Verbose "Created Endpoint [$endpointName] on port [$endpointPort]"
Set-SqlHadrEndpoint -Path $endpointPath -State "Started" -EA Continue | Out-Null
Write-Verbose "Starting Endpoint [$endpointName] (if not already started)"
Invoke-SqlCmd -Query "GRANT CONNECT ON ENDPOINT::[$endpointName] TO [$SqlServiceAccount]" -ServerInstance $server
Write-Verbose "Granting endpoint connect permissions to [$SqlServiceAccount]"
Resources.TestScript:
$endpoint = OSQL -S $env:COMPUTERNAME -E -Q "select count(*) from master.sys.endpoints where name = 'MyMirroringEndpoint'" -h-1
return ([bool] [int] $endpoint[0].Trim() )
